sectionText: Topic Section F: Disability in Literature In this course we will examine historical constructions of disability through literary narratives, as well as how disability itself is used as plot and stylistic device, a mechanism without which much of what we consider ?literary? has been protested by disability activists as stereotypical, unrealistic, and dehumanizing. We will study both the texts, then, and disability studies critiques of these texts. Formal and informal writing about course texts will be required in abundance.  It is strongly recommended that all English and Teaching of English majors take ENGL 300 and ENGL 301 BEFORE taking any other 300- or 400-level courses.
